TITLE: 2022 was the worst-ever year for U.S. bonds. How to position your portfolio for 2023
SUMMARY: In 2022, bond investors suffered worse returns than they have in the last 250 years, according to an investment historian.

TITLE: Here's how to get your student loans forgiven — even if Biden's plan falls through
SUMMARY: Biden's student loan forgiveness plan may fall through. Borrowers should explore the many other loan relief options for which they may qualify.

TITLE: Here are 3 money moves you should make at the start of the year, financial experts say
SUMMARY: January is the best time of the year to draft a budget and check in with your savings goals, experts say.

TITLE: 12 million people got a refund from the IRS for a tax break on 2020 unemployment benefits
SUMMARY: The IRS finished issuing relief to people who qualified for a federal tax break on up to $10,200 of unemployment compensation received in 2020.

TITLE: If you want higher pay, your chances are better now than in 6 months, says expert: 'Make your moves as soon as possible'
SUMMARY: A strong labor market means employees have the upper hand. But that may not last for long, experts say.

TITLE: Successfully applying for Social Security disability is difficult. Applying as a long Covid patient is even trickier
SUMMARY: Even as long Covid puts millions of Americans out of work, proving the condition may be a high hurdle for Social Security disability benefits.

TITLE: How to retire with $2 million if you make $100,000 per year
SUMMARY: Retiring with $2 million on an annual salary of $100,000 might seem out of reach, but it's certainly possible. CNBC's Emily Lorsch breaks it all down.

TITLE: House Republicans vote to strip IRS funding, following pledge to repeal nearly $80 billion approved by Congress
SUMMARY: House Republicans on Monday night voted to slash funding for the IRS, following a pledge to repeal the nearly $80 billion approved by Congress last year.

TITLE: Approaching age 62? What you need to know about Social Security's 8.7% cost-of-living adjustment and claiming benefits
SUMMARY: If you're tempted to claim Social Security retirement benefits early, experts say it may be wiser to wait.

TITLE: Biden administration proposes new student loan repayment plan that could cut some payments in half
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education proposed regulations on Tuesday that would reduce the monthly bills for certain federal student loan borrowers.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot is $1.1 billion. How big winners can prep for 'the inevitable asking for money' from family, friends
SUMMARY: While winning can make you a target for people seeking to benefit from your newfound wealth, there are ways to minimize the requests for money.

TITLE: Americans lean more on credit cards as expenses stay high: 46% of cardholders now carry debt from month to month
SUMMARY: More Americans carry credit card debt from month to month as living expenses stay high, according to a new report by Bankrate.

TITLE: When Social Security beneficiaries can expect first checks of 2023 to include 8.7% cost-of-living adjustment
SUMMARY: More than 65 million Social Security beneficiaries are getting a boost to their benefits this month. Here's when you can expect those payments.

TITLE: What borrowers need to know about Biden's proposed student loan repayment plan, which could cut some payments in half
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has rolled out a new proposal to dramatically lower monthly payments for federal student loan borrowers.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot jumps to $1.35 billion for the next drawing. Here's the tax bill if there's a winner
SUMMARY: Your winnings would be reduced by a 24% federal tax withholding, but that would be just the start of what you'd owe to the IRS and, possibly, state coffers.

TITLE: Proposed ban on noncompete clauses could affect 'every business in the country,' says attorney — what that means for you
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission proposed a rule that would ban noncompete clauses. As a result, wages could rise by nearly $300 billion a year.

TITLE: Did Trump donate his presidential salary in 2020? Tax returns don’t tell full story
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump pledged to donate his salary while in office. Some news reports said his 2020 tax return suggests otherwise — but it's unclear.

TITLE: ‘Don’t wait until March’ to hire a tax pro, says advisor — 3 moves to make before the 2023 tax filing season opens
SUMMARY: Tax season is almost here, and there are key things to know before the IRS begins accepting 2022 individual returns, experts say.

TITLE: Social Security cost-of-living adjustments have fallen short of inflation by $1,054 since the start of pandemic
SUMMARY: As everyday prices have soared, Social Security benefits have not necessarily kept up, according to a new analysis.

TITLE: Tax season opens for individual filers on Jan. 23, says IRS
SUMMARY: The IRS will start accepting 2022 tax returns for individual filers on Jan. 23, the agency announced Thursday.

TITLE: Biden's student loan forgiveness plan is 'unlawful,' two professors say, but legal challenges carry 'dangerous implications'
SUMMARY: Law professors say Biden's student loan forgiveness plan is unlawful but that the Supreme Court should still reject the faulty lawsuit brought against it.

TITLE: Here's the inflation breakdown for December 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Inflation continued to moderate in December, a welcome sign for consumers. Gasoline prices plummeted and many other categories are pulling back.

TITLE: After 'misery' for tax filers in 2022, IRS to start 2023 tax season stronger, taxpayer advocate says
SUMMARY: After another challenging year for the IRS in 2022, the agency may be primed for a better 2023 tax season, according to the Taxpayer Advocate Service.

TITLE: If federal regulators ban noncompete agreements, 'I'd be the first person to start working again,' advisor says
SUMMARY: A member of CNBC's Financial Advisor Council, banned by a noncompete clause from working in financial services, describes what a proposed ban would mean to him.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot is $1.35 billion. Here are 3 tips for navigating a win's 'cycles of surprise,' says advisor
SUMMARY: If you find yourself holding the winning ticket, these three tips can help you get off on the right foot as you start navigating your new-found wealth.

TITLE: School lunch, eggs and airfare: Why inflation soared for 10 items in 2022
SUMMARY: Expiring federal aid, a deadly outbreak of bird flu and war in Ukraine combined to send inflation skyrocketing for a handful of consumer items.

TITLE: 96% of workers are looking for a new job in 2023, poll says: What to know before you job hop
SUMMARY: A whopping 96% of workers are looking for a new position in 2023, largely in search of better pay, according to a recent report by Monster.com.

TITLE: Despite falling inflation, nearly one-third of Americans will rely on tax refunds, survey finds. Here's how to get your refund faster
SUMMARY: Despite falling inflation, many Americans will rely on their tax refund to make ends meet, a survey finds. Here's how to get your tax refund faster.

TITLE: JPMorgan says college-planning firm it bought lied about its scale. Consumers may have been misled, too
SUMMARY: The founder of a college-planning platform allegedly lied to Chase to convince the bank to acquire it. The company's claims to consumers were also dubious.

TITLE: Are you buying 'too much car'? Americans' obsession with pricey options like touch screens is causing an affordability crisis
SUMMARY: With the lucrative luxury segment in such high demand, carmakers are upgrading their lineups and scaling back on less expensive cars.
